summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence primarily between defense attorney Joe Nascimento and federal prosecutors (likely from the SDNY) regarding scheduling meetings and interviews with his client, a cooperating witness in the Epstein investigation. The emails span from July 2019 to August 2021 and discuss logistics, pandemic protocols, and the client's ongoing cooperation following Ghislaine Maxwell's arrest.

persons.name: Joe Nascimento
persons.context: Attorney representing a cooperating witness in the Epstein investigation. He communicates with federal prosecutors to schedule meetings, proffers, and interviews for his client.

persons.name: Allison
persons.context: A federal prosecutor (likely with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York) corresponding with Joe Nascimento to schedule meetings and discuss his client's cooperation.

persons.name: Alan Ross
persons.context: Joe Nascimento's former law partner who previously represented the cooperating witness before his death in 2018.

persons.name: Ghislaine
persons.context: Referenced in the context of her arrest in July 2020, which prompted Joe Nascimento to check in with prosecutors about his client's status.

connections.description: Professional correspondence between a defense attorney and a federal prosecutor regarding a cooperating witness in the Epstein investigation.
Former law partners; Nascimento took over representation of a client after Ross's death.
Nascimento's client is a cooperating witness in the investigation involving Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Arrest
events.description: Joe Nascimento references seeing reports of Ghislaine's arrest and checks in with prosecutors regarding his client's status.

events.title: Initial Meeting in West Palm Beach
events.description: Joe Nascimento and his client meet with federal prosecutors at the Hilton in West Palm Beach, Florida.

events.title: Scheduled In-Person Meeting
events.description: A meeting is scheduled for August 20, 2021, in New York, with discussions about pandemic protocols and vaccination status.

events.title: Scheduled Video Conference Interview
events.description: A video conference interview (via WebEx) is scheduled for the client with federal prosecutors.

events.title: Scheduled Proffer Meeting
events.description: A proffer meeting is scheduled for the client with federal prosecutors at the Hilton in West Palm Beach.

locations: Miami, Florida (Joe Nascimento's law office at 2250 S.W. 3rd Avenue)
West Palm Beach, Florida (Hilton at 600 Okeechobee Blvd, mentioned as a meeting location)
New York, New York (federal building/prosecutor's office near 76 Chambers Street)
keyFacts: Joe Nascimento represents a cooperating female witness in the Epstein investigation who was previously represented by his deceased partner, Alan Ross.
The witness was served with a grand jury subpoena in July 2019 and has been cooperating with the SDNY investigation since at least that time.
Communications reference the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell in July 2020 and confirm the witness's continued cooperative status.
Multiple in-person meetings and proffer sessions were scheduled between 2019 and 2021 in Florida and New York.
The email chain includes detailed logistical planning, including discussions about pandemic protocols, vaccination status, and travel arrangements for the witness.
